column4: I prefer passw0rd...  It has a 0 in it, and that's the strongest shape on the keyboard
I hate password rules, though
you end up with 50 different passwords that all require the same crappy rules
without password rules you end up with a network full of passwords like 'password'

yeah I don't dig password expiry.  you get users with 30 passwords that change every few weeks and have to be secure, and they start taping them to their monitors because they're impossible to remember.
what seems to be the problem
finally got drivers installed but they're gone after reboot... I can get you the error in a second
API mismatch: the NVIDIA kernel module is version 1.0.7667, but this X module is version 1.0.8178...please be sure they all have the same version
you have to tease me like that?  get me started and hopeful and then not say anything? :'(
I'll volunteer to be your brother
you haven't said a single thing to me since you asked what the problem was :)
sorry, I stepped away and may have missed something :)
I thought I removed em all, but I don't know the command to check :)
removed all what?  command to check what?
removed all nvidia packages, command to check if any linger
dpkg -l | grep -i nvidia
thanks.  apt-get and I have to have a little talk.  I see nvidia-glx even though I distinctly remember removing it.
there's also an nvidia-kernel-common, but I can't remove it without removing linux-amd64-generic etc.
dpkg -L the package and remove its files
thank you!
what does it instantly kill?
laptop?
ah, I use the supercoder2000 myself.  watercooled, just two keys, 1 and 0
